lang

Class Expression

  • java.lang.Object
    • lang.Expression
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Expression>

    public class Expression
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Expression>
    Class that represents a mathematical expression, or a equation if isEquation is true.
    Author:
    Luke Senseney

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean isEquation
      If true, it is treated like a equation with the array of Terms set equal to 0.
      static Expression NEGATE
      Expression with a single term, -1
      static Expression ONE
      Expression with a single term, 1
      java.util.ArrayList<Term> terms
      Term array that the sum of is this expression, or are equal to 0 if isEquation.
      static Expression ZERO
      Expression with no terms

    • Field Detail

      • terms

        public java.util.ArrayList<Term> terms
        Term array that the sum of is this expression, or are equal to 0 if isEquation.

      • isEquation

        public boolean isEquation
        If true, it is treated like a equation with the array of Terms set equal to 0. Default is false.

      • ZERO

        public static final Expression ZERO
        Expression with no terms

      • ONE

        public static final Expression ONE
        Expression with a single term, 1

      • NEGATE

        public static final Expression NEGATE
        Expression with a single term, -1

    • Constructor Detail

      • Expression

        public Expression(java.lang.String newEquation)
        Creates a new Expression from a string. If there is a "=" in the string isEquation is true. Cannot handle equations with more than one "=" i.e. a=b=c. Garbage in, Garbage out, if the String is not a correctly formated expression or equation, will attempt to read or throw exception.
        Parameters:
        newEquation - The string to make a equation from.

      • Expression

        public Expression(Term... newTerms)
        Creates a new Expression from a array of Terms
        Parameters:
        newTerms - Terms to make a equation from.

      • Expression

        public Expression(java.util.Collection<Term> newTerms)
        Creates a new Expression from a collection of Terms
        Parameters:
        newTerms - Terms to make a equation from.

      • Expression

        public Expression(java.util.Collection<Term> newTerms,
                  boolean equation)
        Creates a new Expression from a array of Terms, is a equation if equation is true.
        Parameters:
        newTerms - Terms to make a equation from.
        equation - Sets isEquation to this.

    • Method Detail

      • raise

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Term> raise(Expression expression,
                                              Expression power)
        Raises an Expression to another Expression.
        Parameters:

        power - the exponent
        Returns:
        expressionpower

      • raise

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Term> raise(java.util.Collection<Term> expression,
                                              java.util.Collection<Term> power)
        Raises an expression to another expression. It is the equivalent of return raise(new Expression(expression),new Expression(multiplier));
        Parameters:
        expression - the base
        power - the exponent
        Returns:
        expressionpower

      • raiseAndDistribute

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Term> raiseAndDistribute(Expression expression,
                                                           Expression multiplier,
                                                           Expression power)
        Raises an Expression to another and then multiplies by another.
        Parameters:
        expression - the base
        multiplier - the expression the be multiplied.
        power - the exponent
        Returns:
        (expressionpower)*multiplier

      • raiseAndDistribute

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Term> raiseAndDistribute(java.util.Collection<Term> expression,
                                                           java.util.Collection<Term> multiplier,
                                                           java.util.Collection<Term> power)
        Raises an expression to another and then multiplies by another. It is the equivalent of raiseAndDistribute(new Expression(expression),new Expression(multiplier),new Expression(power));
        Parameters:
        expression - the base
        multiplier - the expression the be multiplied.
        power - the exponent
        Returns:
        (expressionpower)*multiplier

      • distribute

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Term> distribute(Expression expression,
                                                   Expression multiplier)
        Multiplies an Expression by another.
        Parameters:
        expression - The main
        multiplier - multiplies expression by this.
        Returns:
        (expression)*(multiplier)

      • distribute

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Term> distribute(java.util.Collection<Term> expression,
                                                   java.util.Collection<Term> multiplier)
        Multiplies an expression by another. It is the equivalent of distribute(new Expression(expression),new Expression(multiplier))
        Parameters:
        expression - The main
        multiplier - multiplies expression by this.
        Returns:
        (expression)*(multiplier)

      • simplifyTerms

        public void simplifyTerms()
        Combines like Terms, removes 0 terms and distributes what it can.

      • factor

        public java.util.ArrayList<Expression> factor()
        Factors out the gcd, and if the remaining expression is a quadratic, factors that with the quadratic formula.
        Returns:
        The factors of this. None will be equations.

      • solve

        public java.util.HashSet<Solution> solve()
                                  throws NotEquation
        Solves the Expression for each variable as best as possible.
        Returns:
        An array of solutions, one for each variable.
        Throws:
        NotEquation - If the Expression is not an Equation.

      • solveFor

        public Solution solveFor(char iso)
                  throws NotEquation
        Solves the equation for the specified variable
        Parameters:
        iso - The variable to solve for.
        Returns:
        The solution for iso
        Throws:
        NotEquation - If this isn't an equation.
